TEXT.TITLE: K MART <KM> SEES SALES INCREASING
TEXT.BODY: K Mart Corp will sell 26 billion dlrs worth of goods in 1987, up from 23.8 billion dlrs in sales in 1986, chairman Bernard M. Fauber predicted. The K Mart official also said the company is committed to "retail automation," and will equip all K Mart stores with slot scanning point of sale register systems. Some 400 systems are already in place. Fauber said each K Mart costs five mln dlrs, including land, building, fixtures, equipment and inventory. Each store serves an average 90,000 customers, he said. Reuter
